item.title: Report E-2024020368
item.description:
Report E-2024020368

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCR experienced a UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite 40% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 ounces of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The released product was neutralized with baking soda and collected with absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into an 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020334
item.description:
Report E-2024020334

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN1805 Low pH Presoak release from a 15-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor/pallet due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and soda ash solution were deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted absorbents and pallet wood were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum of the product was patched with chem tape and placed into a separate 55- gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
